weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a cool crispness, a gentle reminder that winter has woven its soft blanket across the city. The forecast beckons patchy fog after the witching hour, entwining the streets in a mystical veil that adds an ethereal quality to the urban landscape. Currently, the city lies beneath a mostly cloudy sky, hinting at the possibility of the fog rolling in later. Tonight’s low around 47 degrees encourages layers; a light jacket combined with a sweater would serve well against the evening chill while maintaining comfort and style.

Looking ahead to Sunday, the morning may reveal that familiar San Francisco fog lingering before 10 a.m., giving way to a spacious embrace of blue skies as the sun climbs higher. This transition brings a generous dose of sunshine, creating the perfect atmosphere for an afternoon stroll. As temperatures peak near 58 degrees, gradually descending to 56, it invites the residents to engage in leisurely activities—perhaps a visit to one of the local parks or a casual brunch at a sidewalk café, indulging in the warmth of a steaming cup of coffee while basking in the golden glow of the sun. With even the winds whispering gently between 2 to 6 mph, the day promises to unfold with a pleasing sense of serenity.
